data.title: Lavish EU headquarters plans ignore calls for solidarity
data.meta_description: MEPs will press on with a £438 million refurbishment of the European parliament’s Brussels seat and controversial plans to buy new buildings in Strasbourg, incl
data.text:
MEPs will press on with a £438 million refurbishment of the European parliament’s Brussels seat and controversial plans to buy new buildings in Strasbourg, including the conversion of an office block to a special private hotel.

Ignoring calls for solidarity with people and households facing soaring energy and food bills, the parliament’s budget committee has this week decided to continue the building projects.

“It is the worst possible timing,” said Nils Usakovs, a Latvian social democrat MEP.

“We cannot spend our taxpayers’ money irresponsibly, especially in times when European households and businesses have such dramatic financial problems.”
